div.h3: It’s time to register your student for Pre-K or Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year!

img.title: It’s time to register your student for Pre-K or Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year!
img.alt: It’s time to register your student for Pre-K or Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year!

span.div: You can use the following link to fill out the packet online: https://forms.gle/EuLc6woDpPYQce8E8

***If your student was enrolled in Pre-K for the 2019-2020 school year, and plans to return, you DO NOT need to fill out a Kindergarten packet. This is for any new students to the district and students that are not currently enrolled in Pre-K at Slidell Elementary.

Please bring the following paperwork to the Elementary office during normal school hours through the end of the school year
OR
during our office summer hours:
1. May 26th - June 11th (Mon - Thurs) from 8:00 - 3:00
2. July 27th - August 11th (Mon - Thurs) from 8:00 - 3:00
• Certified copy of birth certificate or passport
• Current immunization record signed by a physician or physicians designee
• Proof of residence in the Slidell ISD attendance zone. (An original lease/mortgage agreement, water, natural gas, or electric bills are acceptable.)
• Social Security card
• Legal guardian’s Texas driver’s license or Texas Department of Transportation identification card. If the parent or guardian does not have a Texas driver’s license or a TxDOT ID card, other photo ID will be considered in combination with a birth certificate.

img.title: our town, our teams vs cancer
img.alt: our town, our teams vs cancer
img.a: Our Town, Our Teams vs. Cancer

br.span: Our basketball teams have decided to dedicate the games on February 7th to the cause of the fight against cancer.
PATT is selling spirit shirts in orange or blue for $15. Return the attached order form with payment to either school office by January 27.
On the secondary campus, semester exams will be December 19 & 20. The schedule is attached.

typing-node.p: Students in the Principles of Information Technology class spent some time learning about 3D design using TinkerCAD which is a free online program. The final project was to duplicate a teddy bear.

br.span: Students in grades 2 - 5 competing in UIL were named District Runner-up. Individual Champions are listed below.
UIL & OAP competitors in grades 6 - 8 were named District Champions for the combined championship points for both competitions. Individual academic champions are listed below.
The Slidell Junior High OAP’s production of “The Wonderful Tang” by Beaumont Bruestle earned a silver medal at the District competition.
